Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this problem I need to check each case in the event log against the normative process description and see if any of them deviate Lets start by recalling the normative steps

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First the process always starts with Receive order Then Check inventory must come next After that if inventory is sufficient the next steps are Authorize payment then Package items then Ship order and finally Close order If inventory isnt sufficient after Check inventory it should go to Cancel order and then Close order

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: So the key constraints are the order of activities Let me go through each case one by one

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 Receive order correct Check inventory correct Authorize payment should be after check inventory which is correct Package items after authorization correct Ship order after packaging correct Close order last step correct So this case seems to follow the normal flow But wait according to the description after Ship order it should be Close order which it is So no violation here

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Receive order correct Check inventory correct Package items this is before Authorize payment which is supposed to be after check inventory Wait the correct sequence after check is authorize payment then package But here they did package before authorize Thats a violation Then authorize payment comes after packaging Also ship order comes after packaging which is correct But the order of authorize payment before packaging is wrong So this case has a problem

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 Receive order check inventory authorize payment cancel order ship order close order Wait after cancel order they ship order According to the normative process if inventory is insufficient after cancel it should be close But here after cancel they ship Thats a violation Also the order of activities is after cancel ship then close But the process says that once canceled you cant proceed to ship So this is wrong

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 4 Receive check cancel close Thats correct After check cancel then close So thats okay

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 5 Receive check authorize ship close The problem here is that after authorize payment the next step is ship but according to the norm after authorize payment you should package before shipping So this case has authorize payment followed by ship which is a violation Because the correct sequence is authorize then package then ship So this case is wrong

Name: Validation - PE
Text: So the cases that violate are 2 3 and 5 Let me check again Case 2 After check they did package before authorize Thats wrong Then authorize comes after package But the correct sequence is check authorize package ship close So case 2 is wrong Case 3 After cancel they ship Thats wrong Because after cancel the next step should be close not ship Case 5 After authorize payment they ship which is before packaging So thats wrong So the answer should be cases 2 3 and 5 Now I need to explain each violation in detail based on the normative description Let me make sure I didnt miss any other cases Case 1 is correct Case 4 is correct So thats it
